maml:description.maml:para: Gets policy evaluation events generated as resources are created or updated.

Gets policy evaluation events generated as resources are created or updated. Policy event records can be queried at various scopes based on the time interval specified (defaults to last day). Results can be filtered, grouped, and group aggregations can be computed.
Apply expression for aggregations using OData notation.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Filter expression using OData notation.
ISO 8601 formatted timestamp specifying the start time of the interval to query. When not specified, defaults to 'To' parameter value minus 1 day.
Management group name.
Ordering expression using OData notation. One or more comma-separated column names with an optional 'desc' (the default) or 'asc'.
Select expression using OData notation. One or more comma-separated column names. Limits the columns on each record to just those requested.
ISO 8601 formatted timestamp specifying the end time of the interval to query. When not specified, defaults to time of request.
Maximum number of records to return.
Apply expression for aggregations using OData notation.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Filter expression using OData notation.
ISO 8601 formatted timestamp specifying the start time of the interval to query. When not specified, defaults to 'To' parameter value minus 1 day.
Ordering expression using OData notation. One or more comma-separated column names with an optional 'desc' (the default) or 'asc'.
Policy assignment name.
Select expression using OData notation. One or more comma-separated column names. Limits the columns on each record to just those requested.
Subscription ID.
ISO 8601 formatted timestamp specifying the end time of the interval to query. When not specified, defaults to time of request.
Maximum number of records to return.

command:example.maml:title: -- Example 1: Get policy events in current subscription scope --

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get policy events in the specified subscription scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the specified subscription.

command:example.maml:title: ---- Example 3: Get policy events in management group scope ----

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the specified management group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Get policy events in resource group scope in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the specified resource group (in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Get policy events in resource group scope in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the specified resource group (in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 6: Get policy events for a resource ---------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for the specified resource.

command:example.maml:title: Example 7: Get policy events for a policy set definition in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy set definition (that exists in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 8: Get policy events for a policy set definition in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy set definition (that exists in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 9: Get policy events for a policy definition in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy definition (that exists in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 10: Get policy events for a policy definition in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy definition (that exists in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 11: Get policy events for a policy assignment in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy assignment (that exists in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 12: Get policy events for a policy assignment in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy assignment (that exists in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 13: Get policy events for a policy assignment in the specified resource group in the current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy assignment (that exists in the resource group in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 14: Get policy events in current subscription scope, with OrderBy, Top and Select query options
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyEvent -OrderBy "Timestamp desc, PolicyAssignmentName asc" -Top 5 -Select "Timestamp, ResourceId, PolicyAssignmentId, PolicySetDefinitionId, PolicyDefinitionId"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command orders the results by timestamp and policy assignment name properties, and takes only top 5 of those listed in that order. It also selects to list only a subset of the columns for each record.

command:example.maml:title: Example 15: Get policy events in current subscription scope, with From and To query options

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated within the date range specified for all resources within the subscription in current session context.

command:example.maml:title: Example 16: Get policy events in current subscription scope, with Filter query option
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyEvent -Filter "(PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'deny' or PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'audit') and ResourceLocation ne 'eastus'"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command limits the results returned by filtering based on policy definition action (includes deny or audit actions) and resource location (excludes eastus location).

command:example.maml:title: Example 17: Get policy events in current subscription scope, with Apply specifying row count aggregation

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the number of policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command returns the count of the policy event records only, which is returned inside AdditionalProperties property.

command:example.maml:title: Example 18: Get policy events in current subscription scope, with Apply specifying grouping with aggregation
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyEvent -Filter "PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'audit' or PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'deny'" -Apply "groupby((PolicyAssignmentId, PolicyDefinitionId, PolicyDefinitionAction, ResourceId), aggregate(`$count as NumEvents))" -OrderBy "NumEvents desc" -Top 5

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command limits the results returned by filtering based on policy definition action (includes only audit and deny events). It groups the results based on policy assignment, policy definition, policy definition action, and resource id, and computes the number of records in each group, which is returned inside AdditionalProperties property. It orders the results by the count aggregation in descending order, and takes only top 5 of those listed in that order.

command:example.maml:title: Example 19: Get policy events in current subscription scope, with Apply specifying grouping without aggregation
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyEvent -Filter "PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'audit' or PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'deny'" -Apply "groupby((ResourceId))"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command limits the results returned by filtering based on policy definition action (includes only audit and deny events). It groups the results based on resource id. This generates the list of all resources within the subscription that generated a policy event for at least one audit or deny policy.

command:example.maml:title: Example 20: Get policy events in current subscription scope, with Apply specifying multiple groupings
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyEvent -Filter "PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'deny'" -Apply "groupby((PolicyAssignmentId, PolicyDefinitionId, ResourceId))/groupby((PolicyAssignmentId, PolicyDefinitionId), aggregate(`$count as NumDeniedResources))" -OrderBy "NumDeniedResources desc" -Top 5

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets policy event records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command limits the results returned by filtering based on policy definition action (includes only deny events). It groups the results first based on policy assignment, policy definition, and resource id. Then, it further groups the results of this grouping with the same properties except for resource id, and computes the number of records in each of these groups, which is returned inside AdditionalProperties property. It orders the results by the count aggregation in descending order, and takes only top 5 of those listed in that order. This generates the top 5 deny policies with the most number of denied resources.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Policy Metadata resources
The Get-AzPolicyRemediation cmdlet gets all policy metadata resources or a particular policy metadata resource.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Resource name.
Maximum number of policy metadata resources to return.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Resource name.
Maximum number of policy metadata resources to return.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1: Get all policy metadata resources ---------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all policy metadata resources

command:example.maml:title: - Example 2: Get a collection of 10 policy metadata resources -

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a collection of 10 policy metadata resources

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get a single policy metadata resource with the name 'ACF1348'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a single policy metadata resource with the name 'ACF1348'

maml:description.maml:para: Gets policy remediations.
The Get-AzPolicyRemediation cmdlet gets all policy remediations in a scope or a particular remediation.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Filter expression using OData notation.
Maximum number of records to return.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Filter expression using OData notation.
Scope of the resource. For example, '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{rgName}'.
Maximum number of records to return.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Filter expression using OData notation.
Management group ID.
Maximum number of records to return.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Filter expression using OData notation.
Resource group name.
Maximum number of records to return.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Include details of the deployments created by the remediation.
Management group ID.
Resource name.
Resource group name.
Scope of the resource. For example, '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{rgName}'.
Maximum number of records to return.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Include details of the deployments created by the remediation.
Resource ID.
Maximum number of records to return.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Filter expression using OData notation.
Include details of the deployments created by the remediation.
Management group ID.
Resource name.
Resource group name.
Resource ID.
Scope of the resource. For example, '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{rgName}'.
Maximum number of records to return.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all policy remediations in the current subscription
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Select-AzSubscription -Subscription "My Subscription" PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyRemediation

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all the remediations created at or underneath a subscription named 'My Subscription'.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a specific policy remediation and the deployment details

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the remediation named 'remediation1' from resource group 'myResourceGroup'. The details of the resources being remediated will be included.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get 10 policy remediations in a management group with optional filters

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets a max of 10 policy remediations from a management group named 'mg1'. Only policy remediations for the given policy assignment will be retrieved.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets policy compliance states for resources.

Gets policy compliance states for resources. Policy state records can be queried at various scopes. Based on the time interval specified (defaults to last day), either latest policy states or all policy state transitions can be queried. Results can be filtered, grouped, and group aggregations can be computed.
Within the specified time interval, get all policy states instead of the latest only.
Apply expression for aggregations using OData notation.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Expand expression using OData notation.
Filter expression using OData notation.
ISO 8601 formatted timestamp specifying the start time of the interval to query. When not specified, defaults to 'To' parameter value minus 1 day.
Ordering expression using OData notation. One or more comma-separated column names with an optional 'desc' (the default) or 'asc'.
Resource ID.
Select expression using OData notation. One or more comma-separated column names. Limits the columns on each record to just those requested.
ISO 8601 formatted timestamp specifying the end time of the interval to query. When not specified, defaults to time of request.
Maximum number of records to return.
Within the specified time interval, get all policy states instead of the latest only.
Apply expression for aggregations using OData notation.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get latest policy states in current subscription scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get latest policy states in the specified subscription scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the specified subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get all policy states in current subscription scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all historical policy state records (including latest) generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Get latest policy states in management group scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the specified management group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Get latest policy states in resource group scope in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the specified resource group (in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 6: Get latest policy states in resource group scope in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the specified resource group (in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: ------ Example 7: Get latest policy states for a resource ------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for the specified resource.

command:example.maml:title: Example 8: Get latest policy states for a policy set definition in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy set definition (that exists in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 9: Get latest policy states for a policy set definition in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy set definition (that exists in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 10: Get latest policy states for a policy definition in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy definition (that exists in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 11: Get latest policy states for a policy definition in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy definition (that exists in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 12: Get latest policy states for a policy assignment in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy assignment (that exists in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 13: Get latest policy states for a policy assignment in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy assignment (that exists in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 14: Get latest policy states for a policy assignment in the specified resource group in the current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy assignment (that exists in the resource group in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 15: Get latest policy states in current subscription scope, with OrderBy, Top and Select query options
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyState -OrderBy "Timestamp desc, PolicyAssignmentName asc" -Top 5 -Select "Timestamp, ResourceId, PolicyAssignmentId, PolicySetDefinitionId, PolicyDefinitionId, IsCompliant"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command orders the results by timestamp and policy assignment name properties, and takes only top 5 of those listed in that order. It also selects to list only a subset of the columns for each record.

command:example.maml:title: Example 16: Get latest policy states in current subscription scope, with From and To query options

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated within the date range specified for all resources within the subscription in current session context.

command:example.maml:title: Example 17: Get latest policy states in current subscription scope, with Filter query option
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyState -Filter "(PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'deny' or PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'audit') and ComplianceState eq 'NonCompliant' and ResourceLocation ne 'eastus'"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command limits the results returned by filtering based on policy definition action (includes deny or audit actions), compliance status (includes only non-compliant status) and resource location (excludes eastus location).

command:example.maml:title: Example 18: Get latest policy states in current subscription scope, with Apply specifying row count aggregation

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the number of latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command returns the count of the policy state records only, which is returned inside AdditionalProperties property.

command:example.maml:title: Example 19: Get latest policy states in current subscription scope, with Apply specifying grouping with aggregation
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyState -Filter "ComplianceState eq 'NonCompliant'" -Apply "groupby((PolicyAssignmentId, PolicySetDefinitionId, PolicyDefinitionReferenceId, PolicyDefinitionId), aggregate(`$count as NumStates))" -OrderBy "NumStates desc" -Top 5

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command limits the results returned by filtering based on compliance status (includes only non-compliant status). It groups the results based on policy assignment, policy set definition, and policy definition, and computes the number of records in each group, which is returned inside AdditionalProperties property. It orders the results by the count aggregation in descending order, and takes only top 5 of those listed in that order.

command:example.maml:title: Example 20: Get latest policy states in current subscription scope, with Apply specifying grouping without aggregation

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command limits the results returned by filtering based on compliance status (includes only non-compliant status). It groups the results based on resource id. This generates the list of all resources within the subscription that are non-compliant for at least one policy.

command:example.maml:title: Example 21: Get latest policy states in current subscription scope, with Apply specifying multiple groupings
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyState -Filter "ComplianceState eq 'NonCompliant'" -Apply "groupby((PolicyAssignmentId, PolicySetDefinitionId, PolicyDefinitionReferenceId, PolicyDefinitionId, ResourceId))/groupby((PolicyAssignmentId, PolicySetDefinitionId, PolicyDefinitionReferenceId, PolicyDefinitionId), aggregate(`$count as NumNonCompliantResources))" -OrderBy "NumNonCompliantResources desc" -Top 5

command:example.maml:title: Example 22: Get latest policy states including policy evaluation details for a resource

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets latest policy state records generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command limits the results returned by filtering based on compliance status (includes only non-compliant status). It groups the results first based on policy assignment, policy set definition, policy definition, and resource id. Then, it further groups the results of this grouping with the same properties except for resource id, and computes the number of records in each of these groups, which is returned inside AdditionalProperties property. It orders the results by the count aggregation in descending order, and takes only top 5 of those listed in that order. This generates the top 5 policies with the most number of non-compliant resources.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets latest policy compliance states summary for resources.
Gets a summary view of latest policy compliance state numbers at various scopes, broken down into policy assignments and policy definitions. It includes only non-compliant policy states.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary in current subscription scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary in the specified subscription scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources within the specified subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary in management group scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources within the specified management group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary in resource group scope in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources within the specified resource group (in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary in resource group scope in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources within the specified resource group (in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 6: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary for a resource

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for the specified resource.

command:example.maml:title: Example 7: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary for a policy set definition in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy set definition (that exists in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 8: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary for a policy set definition in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy set definition (that exists in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 9: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary for a policy definition in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy definition (that exists in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 10: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary for a policy definition in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy definition (that exists in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 11: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary for a policy assignment in current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy assignment (that exists in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 12: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary for a policy assignment in the specified subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy assignment (that exists in the specified subscription).

command:example.maml:title: Example 13: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary for a policy assignment in the specified resource group in the current subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources (within the tenant in current session context) effected by the specified policy assignment (that exists in the resource group in the subscription in current session context).

command:example.maml:title: Example 14: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary in current subscription scope, with Top query option

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command orders the policy assignment summaries in the results by non-compliant resource counts in descending order, and takes only top 5 of those policy assignment summaries.

command:example.maml:title: Example 15: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary in current subscription scope, with From and To query options

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated within the date range specified for all resources within the subscription in current session context.

command:example.maml:title: Example 16: Get latest non-compliant policy states summary in current subscription scope, with Filter query option
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzPolicyStateSummary -Filter "(PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'deny' or PolicyDefinitionAction eq 'audit') and ResourceLocation ne 'eastus'"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the summary view of latest policy compliance states generated in the last day for all resources within the subscription in current session context. The command limits the results returned by filtering based on policy definition action (includes deny or audit actions), and resource location (excludes eastus location).

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes a policy remediation.
The Remove-AzPolicyRemediation cmdlet deletes a policy remediation.
Allow the remediation to be canceled if it is in-progress.
Run cmdlet in the background.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The Remediation object.
Return True if the command completes successfully.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Delete a policy remediation at resource group scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command deletes the remediation named 'remediation1' in resource group 'myRG'.

command:example.maml:title: - Example 2: Delete a management group remediation via piping -
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $remediation = Get-AzPolicyRemediation -ManagementGroupName "mg1" -Name "remediation1" PS C:\> $remediation | Remove-AzPolicyRemediation -Confirm

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command deletes the remediation named 'remediation1' from management group 'mg1'. A confirmation prompt will be presented before deleting the resource.

command:example.maml:title: ------ Example 3: Cancel and delete a policy remediation ------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command deletes the remediation named 'remediation1' in resource group 'myRG'. If the remediation is in-progress it will be canceled before being deleted.

maml:description.maml:para: Triggers a policy compliance evaluation for all resources in a subscription or resource group.

The Start-AzPolicyComplianceScan cmdlet starts a policy compliance evaluation for a subscription or resource group. All resources within that scope will have their compliance state evaluated against all assigned policies.
Run cmdlet in the background.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Return True if the command completes successfully.
Resource group name.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Run cmdlet in the background.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Return True if the command completes successfully.
Resource group name.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: --- Example 1: Start a compliance scan at subscription scope ---

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts a policy compliance evaluation for the active subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -- Example 2: Start a compliance scan at resource group scope --

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts a policy compliance evaluation for the "myRG" resource group in the active subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Start a compliance scan and wait for it to complete in the background
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $job = Start-AzPolicyComplianceScan -AsJob PS C:\> $job | Wait-Job

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts a policy compliance evaluation for the active subscription. It will wait for the scan to complete.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates and starts a policy remediation for a policy assignment.

The Start-AzPolicyRemediation cmdlet creates a policy remediation for a particular policy assignment. All non-compliant resources at or below the remediation's scope will be remediated. Remediation is only supported for policies with the 'deployIfNotExists' effect.
Run cmdlet in the background.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The resource locations that should be included in the remediation. Resources that don't reside in these locations will not be remediated.
Management group ID.
Resource name.
Policy assignment ID. E.g. '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/{assignmentName}'.
Gets the policy definition reference ID of the individual definition that is being remediated. Required when the policy assignment assigns a policy set definition.
Describes how the remediation task will discover resources that need to be remediated. ReEvaluateCompliance is not supported when remediating management group scopes.
Resource group name.
Scope of the resource. E.g. '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{rgName}'.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Run cmdlet in the background.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The resource locations that should be included in the remediation. Resources that don't reside in these locations will not be remediated.
Policy assignment ID. E.g. '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/{assignmentName}'.
Gets the policy definition reference ID of the individual definition that is being remediated. Required when the policy assignment assigns a policy set definition.
Describes how the remediation task will discover resources that need to be remediated. ReEvaluateCompliance is not supported when remediating management group scopes.
Resource ID.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Run cmdlet in the background.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The resource locations that should be included in the remediation. Resources that don't reside in these locations will not be remediated.

Policy assignment ID. E.g. '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/{assignmentName}'.
Gets the policy definition reference ID of the individual definition that is being remediated. Required when the policy assignment assigns a policy set definition.
Describes how the remediation task will discover resources that need to be remediated. ReEvaluateCompliance is not supported when remediating management group scopes.
Resource group name.
Resource ID.
Scope of the resource. E.g. '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{rgName}'.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: ----- Example 1: Start a remediation at subscription scope -----
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $policyAssignmentId = "/subscriptions/f0710c27-9663-4c05-19f8-1b4be01e86a5/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/2deae24764b447c29af7c309" PS C:\> Select-AzSubscription -Subscription "My Subscription" PS C:\> Start-AzPolicyRemediation -PolicyAssignmentId $policyAssignmentId -Name "remediation1"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new policy remediation in subscription 'My Subscription' for the given policy assignment.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Start a remediation at management group scope with optional filters

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new policy remediation in management group 'mg1' for the given policy assignment. Only resources in the 'westus' or 'eastus' locations will be remediated.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Start a remediation at resource group scope for a policy set definition assignment

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new policy remediation in resource group 'myRG' for the given policy assignment. The policy assignment assigns a policy set definition (also known as an initiative). The policy definition reference ID indicates which policy within the initiative should be remediated.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Start a remediation and wait for it to complete in the background
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $policyAssignmentId = "/subscriptions/f0710c27-9663-4c05-19f8-1b4be01e86a5/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/2deae24764b447c29af7c309" PS C:\> Select-AzSubscription -Subscription f0710c27-9663-4c05-19f8-1b4be01e86a5 PS C:\> $job = Start-AzPolicyRemediation -PolicyAssignmentId $policyAssignmentId -Name "remediation1" -AsJob PS C:\> $job | Wait-Job PS C:\> $remediation = $job | Receive-Job

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts a new policy remediation in subscription 'My Subscription' for the given policy assignment. It will wait for the remediation to complete before returning the final remediation status.

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Start a remediation that will discover non-compliant resources before remediating
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $policyAssignmentId = "/subscriptions/f0710c27-9663-4c05-19f8-1b4be01e86a5/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/2deae24764b447c29af7c309" PS C:\> Select-AzSubscription -Subscription "My Subscription" PS C:\> Start-AzPolicyRemediation -PolicyAssignmentId $policyAssignmentId -Name "remediation1" -ResourceDiscoveryMode ReEvaluateCompliance

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new policy remediation in subscription 'My Subscription' for the given policy assignment. The compliance state of resources in the subscription will be re-evaluated against the policy assignment and non-compliant resources will be remediated.

maml:description.maml:para: Cancels an in-progress policy remediation.
The Stop-AzPolicyRemediation cmdlet cancels an in-progress policy remediation. Active deployments will be canceled and no new deployments will be created.
Run cmdlet in the background.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Cancel a policy remediation at resource group scope

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command cancels the remediation named 'remediation1' in resource group 'myRG'.

command:example.maml:title: - Example 2: Cancel a management group remediation via piping -
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $remediation = Get-AzPolicyRemediation -ManagementGroupName "mg1" -Name "remediation1" PS C:\> $remediation | Stop-AzPolicyRemediation

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command cancels the remediation named 'remediation1' in management group 'mg1'.
